sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin arriving in China on the opening day of the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics. That's one good reason to be there, but another seems to have been to meet with President Xi Jinping and put on a show of unity against the West. The country's two foreign ministers also met for talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: China is backing Russia in calling for a halt to NATO's eastward expansion, and Moscow is denying concomitant reasons to invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I read some statements by the U.S. State Department that Russia is preparing fake videos showing an alleged attack by Ukrainian troops on Donbas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, I don't know.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The delusional nature of this kind of fabrication, and there are more and more of them every day, it's obvious to any more or less experienced political scientist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The claim of Russia making such a video comes against the backdrop of the continuing arrival reinforcement troops in Eastern European countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We knew from the US that such information, reports of preparing fake videos, would be released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The released information is not surprising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We've seen since 2014 many insidious actions from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We've seen that they will go to all lengths trying to fabricate something and accuse Ukraine." As the military standoff continues, so does the shuttle diplomacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The president of France and the chancellor of Germany have announced that they'll visit Moscow on February 14 and 15 respectively, in further attempts to try to defuse the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Between diplomacy and sanctions, Europe is preparing its response to a potential Russian incursion in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Euronews spoke to Commission President Ursula von der Leyen as tensions simmer on the bloc's eastern borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We see no sign of de-escalation. και την Ursula von der Leyen, όπως οι αγόρες σημαίνουν στις εξωτερικές κόρδες της Μπλοκ. Δεν βλέπουμε κανένα σημασία της αποδιασκαλωσίας.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Στο αντίθετο, βλέπουμε ότι η Ρωσία και τώρα η ΗΠΑ αναμειχθούν περισσότερες εμπορικές σε ουσιαστικά πλευρά.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Βλέπετε, λοιπόν, ότι η διπλωμασία έχει αυξηθεί και τώρα η Ευρώπη πυροβολεί προς μια πραγματική πόλεμη.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Δεν πρέπει ποτέ να αφήσουμε να δουλεύουμε για τη διπλωμασία, γιατί όπως η Ρωσία έχει δημιουργήσει αυτή την κρίση, towards a real war. We should never give up to work on diplomacy because as Russia has created this crisis, we do everything for diplomacy and dialogue to be successful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But we are very clear also that in case that there's any further military aggression of Russia against Ukraine, that this will have severe consequences and massive costs for Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And we have prepared a robust and very comprehensive package of sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Can you tell us more about this package of sanctions?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It would limit the access of Russia to the financial markets of the European Union, and it would limit Russia's access to crucial goods and technology it needs and that cannot be easily supplied and replaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And therefore it must be in the interest of Russia to de-escalate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But can Europe really afford to impose sanctions that could put its energy supplies at risk?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Indeed, this would be a severe situation, but we have done our homework and we are working intensively of preventing and being prepared for such a situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I have created a partnership for energy security with President Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Next week there will be a summit on this energy security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And of course we have spoken to many different LNG suppliers worldwide who are very interested in going into the gap that Russia would leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Finally, I would like to ask you about the EU as a bloc because we see individual member states taking their own initiatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For example, the Hungarian Prime Minister visited Moscow and President Putin and publicly described Russian demands as reasonable and sanctions as pointless. So what is the leverage that the EU as a bloc has in this stage, in this global crisis?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is unity and very strong alignment within the European Union. And what Hungary is concerned so far, they always supported the sanctions against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And they have so far announced that, of course, they will keep the unity with the European Union if it is necessary to act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: OK, President, thank you very much for this interview.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In northwestern Afghanistan, young girls being sold into marriage to grown men is the norm. For desperate families, it is the only way to escape extreme poverty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Around 90% of the Afghanistan population are dependent on aid from the UN and other humanitarian organisations, with 3 million people being displaced in their own country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Rescuers inched closer on Friday to reaching a five-year-old boy trapped for three days in a well in Morocco, in an operation hampered by ground stability. Crowds have gathered extensively at the site, praying for the child's safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The boy, identified as Rayan, fell into a 32-metre deep well, that's 105 feet, located outside his home village of Igran in Morocco's northern Chefchaouen province on Tuesday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As the rescue continues, threats of a landslide loom due to stress to the ground caused by digging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Search crews first used five bulldozers to dig vertically downward to a depth of more than 31 metres, according to Morocco's official MAP news agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Then, on Friday, they started excavating a horizontal tunnel to reach the trapped boy, MAP said, adding that experts in topographical engineering were called upon to help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Prison inmates in Turkey have set mattresses and other bedding alight in the past to protest detention conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: announce the official opening of the Winter Olympic Games. The event is marked by strict prevention measures due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the diplomatic boycotts promoted by the United States in response to alleged human rights abuses in China.
